title: Account Security: Best Practices for Creators & Viewers

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: Security on NOIZ starts with both creators and viewers taking simple but effective precautions. This guide outlines the most important steps.

sections.heading: Two-Factor Authentication
sections.content: We strongly recommend enabling two-factor authentication (2FA) via the Constellation app. This adds an extra layer of security beyond your initial login handshake.

blurbs.label: Quick Reminder
blurbs.text: Always verify that you are logging in through the official Constellation app. NOIZ does not use email/password logins.

sections.heading: Recognizing Suspicious Activity
sections.content: If you receive unexpected messages, support requests, or encounter unusual login activity, report them immediately through the in-app security tools.

sections.heading: Assigning Editors & Mods
sections.content: Be cautious when assigning editor or moderator roles. These permissions grant access to sensitive areas of your channel.
